page.title: 04THE COMMUNITY CENTRE,KINSON
page.content: HISTORY. Pelhams,the building which houses the Centre is a large three storied Georgian house built in 1793 by a Mr.Tait.Amongst its prosperous owners have been the infamous local smuggler Isaac Gulliver,the Rolles Fryers who were a Newfoundland merchant family,and the Rev. Arnold Sharp a descendant of the famous slave emancipator. During the Second World War the house was used by the Civil defence and was to be demolished.After repairs it was handed over to the Community association in 1952.A full time warden was appointed in 1964 and several extensions have been added to the house.
